column9: Price list: Best premium mid-range phones that will dominate Nepal in early 2022
column10:
The year 2021 was the year of premium mid-range smartphones in the context of the Nepali phone market. This is the best category for those who need (almost) premium features on their smartphones at an affordable price. Smartphones in this category are expected to have a flawless performance regardless of their price. Companies like Xiaomi and Samsung have multiple options in this category and also lead the sales.

There are lots of powerful smartphones in this category. Gamers benefit a lot from this category as they get a good processor, great battery backup, cooling system and a big quick responsive display. Today, we have prepared a list of the best premium mid-range smartphone currently available in Nepal that will also dominate the market in early 2022.

Here is the list of best premium mid-range smartphones in Nepal.

Tecno Phantom X is probably the best-looking smartphone in this category. It has a premium design, built of the glass front, glass back and a metal frame. There is a Gorilla Glass protection on both sides of the phone. The phone also has a curved display that gives the user a premium feel. It features an under-display fingerprint sensor.

There is a 6.7-inch Super AMOLED display and has a massive 91.3% screen-to-body ratio. The display also has a 90Hz refresh rate. The phone weighs 201 grams and is 8.7mm thick. It features a 50MP triple camera setup on the back with a dual 48MP on the front. It is the only phone to have a dual camera on the front on the list. The rear camera can record videos in 4K resolution @ 60 fps.

There is a 4700 mAh non-removable Li-Po battery on the phone that supports 33W fast charging. The phone runs on Android 11 with HIOS 7.6 on top and is powered by Mediatek Helio G95 (12nm) chipset.

The price of Tecno Phantom X is Rs 64,999 for a 8/256GB variant.

Phantom X is a premium-looking phone and is probably the phone with the best design in this category. But, when it comes to performance, every other smartphone on this list gets better. It gets a mediocre processor for this price range and an inferior camera as well.

Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G is one of the best mid-range smartphones from Samsung although the brand has lots of other smartphones in this category. It is one of the latest releases of Samsung with a 5G network connectivity option. The phone has a 6.5-inch Super AMOLED display with a resolution of 1,080*2,400 pixels and a refresh rate of 120Hz. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 5. It only weighs 189 grams and is 8.4mm thick. It also has an under-display optical fingerprint sensor and an IP67 dust/water resistant certification.

Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G features a quad-camera setup. The 64MP camera on the back is housed together with a 12MP ultrawide, 5MP macro and 5MP depth sensor. On the front, there is a 32MP camera. Both cameras can record videos in 4K at 30fps.

The phone runs on Android 11 with One UI 3.1 on top. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 778 5G (6nm) chipset while the graphics are handled by Adreno 642L. For battery backup, there is a 4500 mAh Li-Po battery on the phone that supports 25W fast charging.

The price of the Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G is Rs 53,999 for 6/128GB and Rs 55,999 for 8/128GB variants.

Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G provides a good processor, probably the best camera in this category and a higher refresh rate display with IP certification. This can be a great option for Samsung lovers in this category. It is an all-rounder, good for photography, good for gaming and overall good-performance phone. However, the battery life on the phone could have been better. If you want a great battery backup, you can go for Galaxy M62.

Poco F3 GT has especially been designed for gaming purposes. It is the only phone to have a physical trigger button on the phone itself, which can be opened with sliders that are on the side. Other than this, it has a 6.7-inch AMOLED HDR10+ display with a 120Hz refresh rate that reaches a peak brightness of up to 1300 nits. With a metal frame, the phone has a glass front and back, and both of them are protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 5. This phone is also IP53 certified for dust and splash protection.

Poco F3 GT has a triple camera setup on its rare. The 64MP camera is housed together with an 8MP ultrawide and 2MP macro lens. On the front, there is a 16MP camera. The main camera can record videos in 4K at 30fps.

The phone runs on Android 11 with MIUI 12.5 for POCO on top and is powered by MediaTek Dimensity 1200 5G (6nm) chipset. It has a 5065 mAh non-removable battery and supports 67W fast charging. With this power, the phone gets fully charged in just 42 minutes. The audio quality is also good on the phone as it boasts stereo speakers.

The price of the Poco F3 GT in Nepal is Rs 51,999 for an 8/256GB variant.

This is a great deal considering the features Poco F3 GT provides. The UFS 3.1 internal storage on the phone also means faster loading speed and transfer of data. Along with a 120Hz refresh rate display, it also has a whopping 480Hz touch sampling rate, which can be great for gaming.

Though the phone is focused on gaming purposes, it does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack and though it has a 6nm chipset, it could have been better as there are smartphones with Snapdragon chipset which outperforms the flagship Dimensity chipset. Also, cameras are definitely not the strongest point of this phone. But again, considering the price, this is a great deal.

OnePlus has to be on the list as this is the first smartphone brand to actually come out with the idea of a flagship killer. This was the very reason the Nord 2 5G phone got popular in no time. The phone comes with a 6.43-inch Fluid AMOLED HDR10+ display with a maximum resolution of 1,080*2,400 pixels. The phone has a glass front, glass back and a plastic frame. The front and back of the phone are protected by Gorilla Glass 5. The phone weighs 189 grams and is 8.3mm thick.

OnePlus Nord 2 5G gets a triple camera setup on the back. The main 50MP camera is accompanied by an 8MP ultrawide and another 2MP camera. The camera can record 4K videos at 30fps while it can record 1080p videos up to 240fps. On the front, there is a 32MP single camera.

The phone runs on Android 11 with OxygenOS 11.3 on top and is powered by MediaTek Dimensity 1200 5G chipset. Giving life to the phone is a 4500mAh non-removable Li-Po battery. The charging of the battery is extremely fast as it supports a 65W fast charger that can fully charge the phone in just 30 minutes.

The price of OnePlus Nord 2 5G is Rs 59,999 for 8/128GB and Rs 69,999 for 12/256GB variants.

Well, OnePlus always has been one of our favourites. The Nord 2 5G is also a good phone and could have been great. The phone has an excellent build quality, one of the best in the segment. The camera performance, as well as the phone's overall performance, is good as well.

However, OnePlus should have provided a better chipset, not that the one it has is a bad one but with the price range, it should have done better. Also, the phone has no IP certification. The battery charging time is fast, but it should also be noticed that the phone has a 4,500 mAh battery while others on the list have 5,000 mAh or over. The price may be a great disadvantage to the phone as the users have multiple options on the market.

Yet another Poco phone on the list, Poco F3 is the best value for money phone on the list. The phone comes with a 6.67-inch HDR10+ AMOLED display with a resolution of 1,080*2,400 pixels. This phone has a refresh rate of 120Hz and it can reach a peak brightness of up to 1300 nits. The phone has a glass front, glass back and a plastic frame. Similarly, the glass on the front and back is protected by Gorilla Glass 5. It is the slimmest phone in this category with only 7.8mm thickness.

It has a triple camera setup. The main 48MP camera on the back is accompanied by an 8MP ultrawide and a 5MP macro lens. The camera can record videos in 4K at 30fps whereas it can record 1080p resolution videos up to 960 fps. On the front, there is a 20MP camera that can record 1080p videos.

Poco F3 runs on Android 11 with MIUI 12.5.6 for POCO on top and is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 5G (7nm) chipset. There is a 4,520mAh Li-Po battery on the phone that supports 33W fast charging and gets fully charged in just 52 minutes.

The price of Poco F3 is Rs 46,999 for 6/128GB and 51,999 for 8/256GB variants.

Poco F3 offers a lot for its price range. It has a solid build, a good design and a good processor. Gaming can be extremely fun on this mobile as it has probably the best chipset in this price range. Also, 120Hz refresh rate and 360Hz touch sampling rate can make the gaming look really smooth. It has a liquid cool technology as well and has hi-res Dolby Atmos speakers.

Though Samsung phones may provide better photo quality, the cameras on this phone are not bad either. Though limited to 1080p, the 960fps should be really handy.

Our pick for the best premium mid-range smartphone is Realme GT Neo 2. This is the best smartphone from Realme in Nepal. Realme has been really innovative this year and has certainly got a lot of attention in the market, thanks to GT Neo 2.

The phone features a 6.62-inch HDR10+ AMOLED display. It has a refresh rate of 120Hz and a touch sampling rate of 600Hz which is the highest in the market. The phone weighs around 199.8 grams and is 9mm thick. The display of the phone has Gorilla Glass 5 protection.

There is a triple camera setup on the phone. The 64MP main camera on the back is accompanied by an 8MP ultrawide and a 2MP macro lens. The camera can record videos in 4K and at 60fps. On the front, there is a 16MP camera that can record 1080p videos at 30fps.

Realme GT Neo 2 runs on Android 11 with Realme UI 2.0 on top and is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 5G (7nm). There is a 5,000 mAh non-removable Li-Po battery and supports 65W fast charging. This gets the phone full charged in just 36 minutes.

The price of Realme GT Neo 2 is Rs 54,999 for 8/128GB and Rs 60,999 for 12/256GB variants.

Realme GT Neo 2 has a good design, good cameras and a good processor. It offers an incredible gaming performance as well. To prevent heating, this phone also has a stainless steel vapour cooling plus system. The 600Hz touch sampling rate on the phone is probably the first on the market in this category. The phone also captures good photos and is good for night photography as well. The battery backup on the phone is also good and can charge pretty fast.

However, the camera performance could have been better on the phone. Though the photos look good, they are inconsistent and the low-light photos are only fine as long as you do not zoom them. The night mode on the phone also gives different outcomes when another subject is added to the frame. However, the selfie camera is good. The phone even provides a bright light on the screen or a night mode when there is low light and the photos are good. Other than this, it is a great phone.

column9: Realme 9i To Launch On January 10: Here Is The Official Image
column10:
Realme is all set to launch the very first smartphone in the Realme 9 series -- the Realme 9i. The company has now officially confirmed that the device will be launched on January 10th, which makes it the first smartphone to go official from the Realme 9 series.

The official render of the Realme 9i is identical to the leaked render. At the back, the phone has a triple camera setup with a 50MP primary sensor. Similarly, there is also an ultra-wide angle lens and a dedicated macro lens with 2MP resolution.

As per the design, the Realme 9i has a plastic frame with a power button and volume buttons located on the right side. The recessed power will also double as a fingerprint sensor. Just like the frame, the back panel of the Realme 9i will also be made using plastic and the phone will be available in multiple colors.

The Realme 9i is a 4G smartphone, as the phone is based on the Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 SoC. This is an underpowered version of the Snapdragon 695 and is fabbed using 6nm fabrication. The base model of the Realme 9i will offer at least 4GB RAM and 64GB internal storage.

As per the software experience, the phone will ship with Android 12 OS with a custom Realme UI 3.0 skin on top. This will be one of the first mid-range Realme smartphones to ship with the latest version of Android. A 5,000 mAh battery is likely to power the Realme 9i with support for 33W fast charging via the USB Type-C port.

Looking at the specifications, the Realme 9i will be priced around Rs. 15,000 in Vietnam. The smartphone is expected to launch in India in the coming days and is likely to cost a lot less than here when compared to Vietnam.

Along with the Realme 9i, the company is expected to launch models like the Realme 9 and the Realme 9 Pro, which are likely to be 5G smartphones, based on either Qualcomm or MediaTek processors. Also note that the company is also gearing up for the launch of the Realme GT 2 Pro, the first premium flagship smartphone, based on a Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 processor.

column9: OnePlus 10 Pro Expected To Sport 12GB RAM - TechShout
column10:
The phone will be powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 chipset and will run on the Android 12 operating system, reports GizmoChina.

As per the 3C certification, the OnePlus 10 Pro with model number NE2210 supports output of 7.3ampere at 11V. It translates to a whopping 80W fast charging speed.

So far the fastest charging supported by the OnePlus devices is 65W. With the 80W fast charging speeds, the OnePlus 10 Pro will become the fastest charging OnePlus device, the report said.

Other than this, the phone was previously touted to come equipped with a 5,000mAh battery. It will be supported by a 50W wireless charging support. The device is likely to be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 SoC.

A recent report said that the smartphone is expected to sport a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with a 2K resolution. The screen will be curved on either side and sport a hole-punch cutout at the top left corner.

The OnePlus 10 Pro will come preinstalled with Android 12 OS. As the company had revealed a few months ago, it will be the first device to offer a unified experience of ColorOS and OxygenOS.

In June, OnePlus announced that it has decided to further integrate with its sister smartphone brand OPPO and merge with it in a bid to create better products.

In an official forum note, earlier, Lau said that it will also allow them to be more efficient, for example, bringing faster and more stable software updates for OnePlus users.

column9: Xiaomi 12 Ultra Likely To Be Introduced in China Next Month: Report | 📲 LatestLY
column10:
Beijing: Smartphone brand Xiaomi, which has recently unveiled its Xiaomi 12 series, is now likely to unveil a new smartphone -- Xiaomi 12 Ultra -- in February. According to GizmoChina, a tipster has confirmed that the device may launch after the Chinese Spring festival. Xiaomi 12 Ultra will initially get released in China and may have a global release later in the future. Xiaomi 12, Xiaomi 12 Pro & Xiaomi 12X Launched, Check Prices & Other Details Here.

The report said that the Xiaomi 12 Ultra carrying the codename L1 will have major camera highlights. One of them would be the periscope super-telephoto lens. In addition to this information, a previous leak revealed the device may come with Leica-powered camera sensors.

Recently, Leica ended its partnership with Huawei which may result in a new collaboration and it could be with Xiaomi. The smartphone was previously tipped to come with a quad-camera system at the rear. It will boast a 50MP main Samsung GN5 primary lens, a 48MP 2x zoom lens, a 48MP lens with 5x zooming capability and lastly a 48MP sensor with 10x zoom.

Apart from the cameras, the Xiaomi 12 Ultra is expected to come with a display that is around 6.5 to 6.6-inch in size and will have a 2k screen resolution. This is similar to the recently launched Xiaomi 12 Pro's display. Under the hood, Xiaomi 12 Ultra will come powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 SoC and is expected to have an ultrasonic fingerprint scanner. The phone may come with fast charging support similar to the Xiaomi 12 Pro's 120W rapid charging.

column9: Apple AirPods Pro 2 Massive Leak: Release Window, Form Factor, Specs And More
column10:
AirPods have give Apple users a wireless delight that packs a punch despite its small size. Keep it safe with a waterproof casing.

Apple may release its next best in-ear audio device, reportedly called AirPods Pro 2, this year. The new product will sport a refreshed design and be equipped with several other major upgrades, according to a new set of leaks.

The latest set of information about Apple's AirPods Pro 2 came from TF International Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo. In the latest note to investors, which was discovered by Macrumors, the analyst explained that the second-generation AirPods Pro will have major selling points, which will trigger a strong market demand.

These new features reportedly include a charging case that emits a sound to indicate its location when triggered and support the company's proprietary audio coding format, the Apple Lossless Audio Codec (ALAC).

Photo: Feruzbek Matkarimov / Pexels

The charging case will most likely work with the Find My App to highlight its location. Kuo's information seemingly supports previously leaked photos of the Apple AirPods Pro 2, which highlights the charging case with holes.

In terms of the support for ALAC, previous and current generation AirPods do not support this audio coding format because the devices play audio via Bluetooth, which restricts them to the AAC codec. But the latest detail may support what Tom Parsons of What Hi-Fi gathered about the next generation Apple earbuds when he interviewed Gary Geaves, the company's VP of acoustics.

"Reading between the lines, I reckon Apple has a plan for overcoming Bluetooth's current limitations. That could be as simple as switching to Qualcomm's recently announced aptX Lossless format, but I wonder if Apple might have its alternative to Bluetooth up its sleeve," Parsons said in an article.

Bloomberg had also reported that the next AirPods Pro could lose the traditional stem and sport a more discrete design having a resemblance to the Beats Studio Buds. The report said the tech giant is testing the design, so it remains to be seen if the final product would look like this.

Earlier rumors suggested that Apple might release the AirPods Pro 2 in the third quarter of 2022, which is a little bit earlier than Kuo's Q4 2022 release window prediction. While these details about AirPods Pro 2 are interesting, they are not official.

Consumers should take these details as highly speculative at this stage. The Cupertino-based tech titan released a Magsafe-compatible case last year, but so far, it has not updated the AirPods Pro after it was launched in the market in 2019.

column9: Samsung Galaxy S21 FE Unboxing Videos Are Here
column10:
Samsung's Galaxy S21 FE already might be among the most leaked smartphones ever, and now it has been fully unveiled in unboxing videos that show everything, including packaging and accessories. This is a real treat for Samsung fans to get an early look at how the phone looks in natural light and when being held.

Samsung is a prolific manufacturer, launching several new phones each year and covering a wide range of pricing to meet almost every budget. The most exciting devices, of course, cost more. For example, the top-of-the-line Galaxy S21 Ultra features a 108-megapixel image sensor that allows a 100 times zoom and stabilization so good that a close-up of the moon can be captured. By comparison, the Galaxy S21 and S21-Plus come with a 64-megapixel sensor and can manage a 30 times digital zoom.

Samsung's Galaxy S21 FE is expected to be a lower-cost option for anyone interested in a Galaxy S21, sacrificing build-quality somewhat to bring a lower cost while keeping the integrated style that sets the S21 series apart from many other phones. An unboxing video was spotted by Twitter user @chunv8888. It has been taken down since but was saved to a Google Drive account and can be downloaded and viewed. Another unboxing YouTube video, this time in Italian, is still live, courtesy of HDBlog's channel. In both cases, the Galaxy S21 FE is shown along with its packaging and accessories, unwrapped and held in hand, giving a tremendous real-world look at this exciting addition to the S21 lineup.

Samsung Galaxy S21 FE Looks Great

Multiple unboxing videos have been posted online showing the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE in hand, turning and revealing every angle and detail. It's definitely a nice-looking phone. One video shows an olive-toned Galaxy S21 FE that will stand out by virtue of the unusual color, while the other demonstrates the black model, looking quite stealthy with a matte finish. The only gleam from the back is around the cameras, with a silver ring surrounding each lens.

Specifications are shared in the videos. There are no surprises, matching previous leaks that suggest the Galaxy S21 FE will feature the Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 or Exynos 2100 in some markets, cameras that match the S21 and feature a nice bright screen with a 120-hertz refresh rate. The hands-on video will be a worthwhile watch for anyone interested in this device to see the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE in use before the official announcement.

Source: @chunv8888/Twitter, HDBlog's/YoiTube
